fields.summary: Supplier Booking - expand the pilot
fields.description:
The business would like to expand the pilot for PO-delivery control to include all MoT and the following PM China, Vietnam, Cambodia and Myanmar. The pilot was limited to PM=China and MoT=Sea. 

This CR should be considered as a first step to improve the functionality in PO-devilry control. Coming improvements will be:
i. E-mail functionality should be handle by the Communication solution implemented in Nellie release
ii. Additional filter needs to added (Qty-filter: x > qty added by user, save filter and/or disregard PM)
iii. Checked function should not be valid on "PM-level" not "Order-level"

*Scenario 1 – Unlock filters for PO-Delivery Control*
Given a user is logged in And have opened PO-Delivery Control page
When the user selects Unbooked Deliveries
Then it should be possible to select all, for the user available, Mode of Transport and Planning Market
And the text visible under Unbooked Deliveries should be removed.
Please see attached pictures PO-Delivery Control 1 and PO-Delivery Control 2

 *Scenario 2 – Add filter for CoP*
Given a user is logged in 
When the user opened PO-Delivery Control page
Then it should be possible to filter on Country of Production (CoP)
And the filter should be the same kind of option set as for Planning Market
And available options should be CoP the user has access to
Please see attached pictures PO-Delivery Control 2

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.summary: When copied the url to another browser window, it doesn't open the selected tab.
fields.description:
1) Login to OFU Application
2) Click on any Order to open it in Order details page
3) Click on Any tab(Production Unit, Delivery Info, Price & Package & Article & Size) Say it is PU Tab.
4) Copy the URL 
5) Open a new browser or Tab and paste the copied URL and Enter

Actual Result:
Order details page opened but PU tab doesn't displayed.
Expected Result:
PU tab should be displayed on order details page

fields.summary: Investigation - Order updates in delivery info
fields.description:
In the delivery info for a PM of an order a new Order Update row should only be created if an Order Update is done and TOD/ISW/MOT/QTY is changed.

Since there are several examples where duplicate order update rows for a pm of an order (see attached picture) an investigation needs to be done to see if OFU has a defect.

fields.summary: View new headers in the Status Overview
fields.description:
As an OFU user
I want the Status Overview column headers to be changed
so that I will understand what type of information I can expect to find in the columns

*Preconditions*
OFU-2187 View Status Overview Tab

*Scenario 1: Show new headers in the Status Overview*
Given that the Status Overview is opened
When viewing the column headers to the right of the "OPD" column
Then the headers are the following (placed from left to right):
"Production Units", "Composition", "Counter Sample", "Licence Sample", "Production Sample", "Purchase Order"

*Scenario 2: Show new filter header*
Given Scenario 1
When Viewing the filter headers
Then the header shown above the "New and Updated" filter is "Purchase Order"

*Scenartio 3: Show OPD tooltip*
Given Scenario 1
When the user hoovers over the column header "OPD"
Then the tooltip "Order Placement Date" is shown

fields.summary: Show tooltips in Status Overview (all column headers)
fields.description:
As an OFU user
I want tooltips available for the Status Overview column headers
so that I will understand what type of information I can expect to find in the columns

*Preconditions*
OFU-2187 View Status Overview Tab

*Scenario 1-7: Show Tooltip*
Given that the Status Overview is opened
When the user hoovers over the column header <Column Header> 
Then the tooltip <Tooltip Text> is shown
(see the values in the table below)

||Scenario||Column Header||Tooltip Text||
|1|OPD|Order Placement Date|
|2|PU|Production Unit Status|
|3|Composition|Composition Status|
|4|C/S Status|Counter Sample Status|
|5|L/S Status|Licence Sample Status|
|6|P/S Status|Production Sample Status|
|7|Order Package|Order Package Status|

"Owner of", "User of"

See the attached images.

The defect is found in the Dit environment.

fields.summary: User Filter not working on Status Overview Tab
fields.description:
On OrderList page 
1. Create a New Filter.
2. Add some filter items to it and save it.
3. Select "My Orders" filter.

Now select tab is "Status Overview" 
1 the newly created filter

Expected: the filter items are populated and the result is filtered.
Actual: the filter items are not populated and the result is unchanged.

Expected: the focus should remain on top of the page
Actual: the focus is moved to the "Status Overview" tab and the page scrolls down.

I want to be able to filter the orders in the order list so that only orders with the Order Package statuses "Not Set" (i.e. blank), "New" or "Updated"

When viewing the top of the page

AND a new filter header is shown "Order Package"
AND one checkbox "New and Updated" is shown below the header

fields.summary: SIT : OFU Internal Error while approving ISW change request
fields.description:
Precondition : Definite order exist in HMOrder

Steps :
1. Open OFU, Using Merchandiser access request for eariler ISW for trail order (Existing ISW W01 2015 change it to W52 2014)
2. Swtich to Buyer access and try to approve the request, Results in Internal Error
3. After closing the error, The Refresh wheel keeps on spinning with no updates sent to HMO

Expected : The request should get approved without any error

Please refer to the attached screenshot and video

fields.summary: View Assigned Production Units
Page Refresh issue
fields.description:
Page Refresh issue with Capbality drop-down  (Scenrio 3 ) 

Step to reproduce :
1. Go to "Production Unit" tab for an order
2. Click on Assign/Edit button for any processing unit assigned to an order
where selected processing PU for which value of isOrderplacementok = 0 and at least 2 capabilities are assigned

3. "Remove one capabilities and save  , 
4. Click on Assign/Edit button for a processing unit 

Expected :

user should be able to see the capabilities assigned to the PU in Drop-Down 

Actual :

user is able to view all selected capbalites if user dont refresh the page

If user refresh the page, it is working as expected

Above defects are not fixed yet, able to reproduce the defect in below scenario:
Following the Scenario 2: for previously assigned production units.
When tab is open in edit mode and you select a Processing unit in dropdown list and then deselect and Click on Save button,
PU tab saved eventhough there were no changes to be saved. It should throw the error message in this case.
It is working fine when doing same steps with manufacturing unit or component unit.

fields.summary: View new web browser tab headers
fields.description:
As a user
I want the browser tab to include info about what page that is open
So that I can see the difference between the open tabs and will be able to easily navigate between them

*Scenario 1: View tab text*
Given that the user has opened page <Page> in OFU
When viewing the browser tab
Then the text shown in the tab <Text>
(See the table below)

||Scenario	||Page||Text||
|1|Order list|"OFU - Order list"|
|2|Order Details|"OFU - [Order Number]"|
|3|Pre-Advice|"OFU - Pre-Advice"|
|4|PO Delivery Control|"OFU - PO DelCon"|

Order Number format is [OrderNumber-Department]. Example: 144407-7812.

fields.summary: IE11.0 Compatibility Test- Cannot export data to Excel
fields.description:
*Scenario:*  As a user I would like to export data to Excel by clicking on the Excel icon using IE 11 as browser

*Actual result:* Excel is not started with the exported data. After a while the user gets a server error. On occation is Excel started but it takes very long time to do so.

*Expected result:* Excel is started with the data exported from OFU.

fields.summary: (Prio 2) View Speed tag on Order
fields.description:
As a merchandiser 
I want to be able to see if an order is tagged with speed
so that I can prioritize to work with this order

*Scenario 1: View Order tags in list*
Given Disco-804 
When the users open the Order list 
Then the column Tag should show the Speed tag that is set on the order 
If more than one tag is set on order 
Then the tag with the highest priority should be shown in the list after the following priority
1. VIP red
2. VIP blue
3. Speed
And the tag should be displayed with three dots behind it "..."
And it should be a tooltip that gives information of the other tag(s) connected to the order
See attached picture "Tag in Order list"

*Scenario 2: View speed tag on order*
Given Disco-804 
When the users open the tagged order
Then the tag set on order should be visible in the order header, just to the right of the order name and number and possible tags RI and TPP
See attached picture "Tag Order page - (two tags)"

*Scenario 3: Sort tags column*
Given Sceanrio 1
When the user clicks on the column header for Tag column
Then the list of tags should be sorted with below sort order after visible tag.
-VIP red
-VIP blue 
-Speed


*Scenario 4: Filter on tags*
Given user Disco-804 and user is logged in
When user opens Advanced filter
Then it should be possible to filter on Speed
Needs to be sorted out!!!!

*Scenario 5: Export to Excel*

fields.summary: Able to save the PU in case no changes have done to assigned PUs.
fields.description:
Scenario2 is failing following below steps.

Login to OFU application
Open an Order already having assigned PUs on PU tab.
Click on Edit button to edit the PUs
In edit mode, select a PU from dropdown list and then deselect.
Now click on Save button

Actual Result:  Saved the assigned PUs and PU tab turned in Non-edit mode, Also it triggered the Exports
Expected Result: It should throw the error message when there is no change in assigned PUs as mentioned in requirement.

*This is a Testing Task!!*

Castor/PDP is also installed in DIT, we should do some regression testing already. 

Test that or connection to PDP works, with focus on Option, Sample and Communication. Communication is most important since that solution has been exchanged since we did the early tests in June. 

Tests needed on Sample and OrderAssignedProductionUnit and OrderAssignedProductionUniteport

fields.summary: View small buttons to the left of the order details page
fields.description:
As a user
I want the OFU2 buttons to be shown as small icons to the left of the top header of the Order Details page
So that they do not require so much page space and so they look more like the buttons in Castor

*Scenario 1: View small icons to the left of the top header*
Given that the order details page is shown
When viewing the Order Details page
Then the buttons “Secure Composition”, “Handle Option”, “Handle Sample” and “Send Order Package” are shown as small icons (size 16 pixels) to the left of the top header 
AND no titles are shown below the icons
AND a separating line is shown between the icons  and the top header

*Scenario 2-5: Show tooltip”
Given scenario 1
When the user is hovering over the icon<ICON>
Then the message <MESSAGE> is shown as a tooltip
||Scenario	||Icon||Message||
|2|Secure Composition (navigate to SCSC)|“Secure Composition”|
|3|Handle Option (navigate to Castor/ Handle)|“Handle Option”|
|4|Handle Sample (navigate to Castor/ Handle)|“Handle Sample”|
|5|Send Order Package|“Send Order Package”|

fields.summary: Defect when importing despatch advice
fields.description:
When we import dispatch advice from SPC with changed shipping information for a PM of an Order it seems like we update all PM that belong to that order Not just the one that actually have changed information.

This means that if an order has x nbr of PM and one is updated with new shipping information. x-1 PM will get a new "row" in its delivery info with the exact same information as before since the change wasn't at that PM.

See attached picture how it can look in OFU.

*Scenario 1: Dispatch advice for multiple order with multiple planning markets*
Given an order ORDER1
Given a second order ORDER2
Given ORDER1 has planning market PM1
Given ORDER2 has planning market PM1
Given ORDER2 has planning market PM2
Given a dispatch advice
Given dispatch advice has two shipment stages STAGE1 and STAGE2
Given STAGE1 has shipment line for ORDER1 for PM1
Given STAGE1 has shipment line for ORDER2 for PM1
Given STAGE1 has shipment line for ORDER2 for PM2
Given STAGE2 has shipment line for ORDER1 for PM1
Given STAGE2 has shipment line for ORDER2 for PM1 
When the dispatch advice is imported
THEN ORDER1 for PM1 should get 1 new shipping history item
THEN ORDER2 for PM1 should get 1 new shipping history item
THEN ORDER2 for PM2 should get 1 new shipping history item

Please note that for an order a correlated FollowupOrder is created
For an OrderPlanningMarket a correlated OrderDelivery is created
Shipping history is stored in the OrderDeliveryHistory table and hence related to an OrderDelivery (which in turn is related to the OrderPlanningMarket)

fields.summary: View unique shipping info only
fields.description:
As a user
I only want to see shipping info if the TOD, QTY or MOT is changed
so that no duplicates are shown, only unique shipping info

Please note!
There is a need to run the database scripts for cleanup once again when this CR goes into production (SQL which we will execute for OFU-2395)

*Scenario 1: No changes in TOD, QTY or MOT*
Given that a shipping info is displayed for a planning market for an order
AND that a new shipping info is received with no changes on TOD, QTY or MOT
When the delivery history is shown for the planning market
THEN no new history item has been created for the new shipping info

*Scenario 2: Updated TOD, QTY or MOT*
Given that a shipping info is displayed for a planning market for an order
AND that a new shipping info is received with changes on either TOD, QTY or MOT
When the delivery history is shown for the planning market
THEN a new history item has been created for the new shipping info

*Scenario 3: New Shipping info*
Given that no shipping info is displayed for a planning market for an order
AND that a new shipping info is received
When the delivery history is shown for the planning market
THEN A new history item has been created for the new shipping info

I only want to see new shipping info if the TOD, QTY or MOT is changed

items.toString:
As a user
I only want to see shipping info if the TOD, QTY or MOT is changed
so that no duplicates are shown, only unique shipping info

*Scenario 1: No changes in TOD, QTY or MOT*
Given that a shipping info is displayed for a planning market for an order
AND that a new shipping info is received with no changes on TOD, QTY or MOT

When the delivery history is shown for the planning market
Then the latest received shipping info is shown

*Scenario 3: New Shipping info*
Given that no shipping info is displayed for a planning market for an order
AND that a new shipping info is received
When the delivery history is shown for the planning market
Then the latest received shipping info is shown

fields.summary: SIT - OFU crash when deleting characters in search field
fields.description:
*Scenario:* As a OFU user I'd like to search on order 938220. I type the order number in the search field. When all 6 digits in the ordernumber is typed I change my mind and delete the digits one by one starting with the zero. 

*Actual result:* OFU crashes with the error message: *{color:red} _An error occurred during action An error has occurred with order search_ {color}* when the last digit is deleted. Please find attached video which visualizes the error.

*Expected result:* OFU shouldn't 'crash'

fields.description:
As a merchandiser
I want to be able to filter on imported Speed tag
So that I can find the order that I need to handle with speed

*Scenario 1: Filter on tags*
Given user Disco-804 and user is logged in
When user opens Advanced filter
Then it should be possible to filter on Speed
And the choice to filter on Speed tag should be made by one check box 
And the search logic should be the same as for the other checkboxes in Advanced Find
And the checkboxes Speed should be placed under VIP blue and above Top Priority Product, see attached picture (Tag - Advanced Find) shows.

So that I can find the order that I need to handle with speed

*Scenario 1: Filter on tags*
Given user Disco-804 and user is logged in
When user opens Advanced filter
Then it should be possible to filter on Speed
And the choice to filter on Speed tag should be made by one check box 
And the search logic should be the same as for the other checkboxes in Advanced Find
And the checkboxes Speed should be placed under VIP blue and above Top Priority Product, see attached picture (Tag - Advanced Find) shows.

fields.summary: View Inactivated PU in the List of Assigned Production Units
fields.description:
As a user 
I want to see all production units assigned to the order in the list of the Production Units tab even if the status has been changed to isOrderPlacementOK = 0 of any of the units
so that I will be able to keep the PU assigned to the order (or manually remove it from the order)

*Scenario 1: Show PU in the list after isOrderPlacementOK is set to 0*
Given that at least one production unit assigned to an order has status "isOrderPlacementOK" = 0
When viewing the list of assigned production units in the Production Units tab
Then all assigned production units are shown irrespective of the value of "isOrderPlacementOK" (i.e. 0 or 1)

*Scenario 2: Show Capabilities for PU in the list after isOrderPlacementOK is set to 0*
Given Scenario 1
AND that the Production Unit is a Processing Unit
When viewing the processing unit
Then the selected Capability/capabilities is/are shown in the dropdown

*Scenario 3: Show empty Capabilities list for PU after isOrderPlacementOK set to 0*
Given Scenario 2
When the user clicks on the dropdown list 
Then the dropdown list is empty


*Please note* that according to the business there is no need for showing the status change in the GUI, since the merchandiser and the supplier always communicate when this status changes, so they will know if the PU needs to be removed manually or not.

fields.summary: View Order Package Status in Status Overview
fields.description:
As a merchandiser working with preproduction
I want to see the status of the Order Package in the order Status list
So that I will know if the order is ready for production or if I will need to act

*Preconditions:*
OFU-2187 View Order Status List 
AND DISCO-620 Import OrderedProductSpecification from Castor
AND DISCO-760 Import OrderReport Info (New Integration)

*Scenario 1: Show the Order package column*
Given OFU-2187, Scenario 1
When the user opens/views the Status Overview tab
Then the "Order Package" column is shown to the right in the list 
AND the VIP column is no longer shown in the Status Overview tab
(see the attached image)

*Scenario 2-6: Show the  Order package status*
Given Scenario 1
AND that the Order Package status of an order is <Order Package Status>
When the user views the Order Status List of the Status Overview tab
Then the value shown in the "Order Package " column for the order is <Order Package Column Value>
AND the background colour of the coloumn cell is <Background Colour>
(see the table below)

||Scenario|| Order Package Status|| Order Package Column Value||Background Colour||
|2|Not Sent| (blank/space)|white|
|3|New|New|orange|
|4|Sent|Sent|green|
|5|Updated|Updated|orange|
|6|Migrated|Migrated|white|
Please note that the Migrated status will be set by the DBA when migrating the data for the Nellie release.

OFU-2187 View Order Status List 
AND DISCO-620 Import OrderedProductSpecification from Castor
AND DISCO-760 Import OrderReport Info (New Integration)

*Scenario 1: Show the Order package column*
Given OFU-2187, Scenario 1
When the user opens/views the Status Overview tab
Then the "Order Package" column is shown to the right in the list 
AND the VIP column is no longer shown in the Status Overview tab
(see the attached image)

*Scenario 2-6: Show the  Order package status*
Given Scenario 1
AND that the Order Package status of an order is <Order Package Status>
When the user views the Order Status List of the Status Overview tab
Then the value shown in the "Order Package " column for the order is <Order Package Column Value>
AND the background colour of the coloumn cell is <Background Colour>
(see the table below)

||Scenario|| Order Package Status|| Order Package Column Value||Background Colour||
|2|Not Sent| (blank/space)|white|
|3|New|New|orange|
|4|Sent|Sent|green|
|5|Updated|Updated|orange|
|6|Migrated|Migrated|white|
Please note that the Migrated status will be set by the DBA when migrating the data for the Nellie release.

fields.summary: Filter by Purchase Order status "New and Updated"
fields.description:
As an order follow up merchandiser
I want to be able to filter the orders in the order list so that only orders with the Purchase Order statuses "Not Set" (i.e. blank), "New" or "Updated"
So that I easily can find the orders for which I need to send an Purchase Order to the supplier

*Preconditions*
DISCO-760 New Integration: Import OrderReport Info (New Integration)
OFU-2456 UI Change for the demo - Update filter header
OFU-2479 View new headers in the Status Overview

(Scenario 1 is still valid, crossed out bc its already implemented in OFU-2456 AND header later updated in OFU-2479)
-*Scenario 1: Show filter checkbox "Purchase Order" / "New and Updated"*-
-Given that the Order List/ Status Overview tab is open-
-When viewing the top of the page-
-Then No Production Unit Filters are shown (i.e. PU Not Assigned and PU Qty Diff)-
-AND a new filter header is shown "Purchase Order"-
-AND one checkbox "New and Updated" is shown below the header-

*Scenario 2: Show orders with Purchase Order status "not set", "New" and "Updated" only*
Given Scenario 1
When the user checks the "New and Updated" checkbox
Then the page is reloaded showing only orders with Purchase Order status "Not Set" (shown as blank), "New" or "Updated".

*Scenario 3: Show orders with any Purchase Order status*
Given Scenario 2
When the user unchecks the "New and Updated" checkbox
Then the page is reloaded showing orders with any Purchase Order status

*Scenario 4: Show the number of orders in the scope of the filter*
Given Scenario 1,2 or 3
When viewing the top of the page
Then the number of orders in the scope of the filter is shown within parenthesis after the filter name.

*Scenario 5: Save filter including the "New and Updated" filter *
Given Scenario 2
AND a new filter is saved Or an existing filter is updated to include the "New and Updated" filter
When that filter is selected 
Then the order list and the Status Overview are only including orders with Purchase Order status "Not Set" (shown as blank), "New" or "Updated".

*Scenario 6: Remove the "New and Updated" filter from a saved filter*
Given Scenario 5
AND that the "New and Updated" checkbox is unchecked
AND that the filter is saved
When that filter is selected 
Then the order list and the Status Overview are including orders with any Purchase Order status

(See the attached images)

*Please note that the column and the filter previously called "Order Package" now is called "Purchase Order".*

Then the order list and the Status Overview are including orders with any Purchase Order status

(See the attached images)

*Please note that the column and the filter previously called "Order Package" now is called "Purchase Order".*
items.toString:
As an order follow up merchandiser
I want to be able to filter the orders in the order list so that only orders with the Purchase Order statuses "Not Set" (i.e. blank), "New" or "Updated"
So that I easily can find the orders for which I need to send an Purchase Order to the supplier

*Preconditions*
DISCO-760 New Integration: Import OrderReport Info (New Integration)
OFU-2456 UI Change for the demo - Update filter header
OFU-2479 View new headers in the Status Overview

(Scenario 1 is still valid, crossed out bc its already implemented in OFU-2456 AND OFU-2479)
-*Scenario 1: Show filter checkbox "Order Package" / "New and Updated"*-
-Given that the Order List/ Status Overview tab is open-
-When viewing the top of the page-
-Then No Production Unit Filters are shown (i.e. PU Not Assigned and PU Qty Diff)-
-AND a new filter header is shown "Purchase Order"-
-AND one checkbox "New and Updated" is shown below the header-

*Scenario 2: Show orders with Purchase Order status "not set", "New" and "Updated" only*
Given Scenario 1
When the user checks the "New and Updated" checkbox
Then the page is reloaded showing only orders with Purchase Order status "Not Set" (shown as blank), "New" or "Updated".

*Scenario 3: Show orders with any Purchase Order status*
Given Scenario 2
When the user unchecks the "New and Updated" checkbox
Then the page is reloaded showing orders with any Purchase Order status

*Scenario 4: Show the number of orders in the scope of the filter*
Given Scenario 1,2 or 3
When viewing the top of the page
Then the number of orders in the scope of the filter is shown within parenthesis after the filter name.

*Scenario 5: Save filter including the "New and Updated" filter *
Given Scenario 2
AND a new filter is saved Or an existing filter is updated to include the "New and Updated" filter
When that filter is selected 
Then the order list and the Status Overview are only including orders with Purchase Order status "Not Set" (shown as blank), "New" or "Updated".

*Scenario 6: Remove the "New and Updated" filter from a saved filter*
Given Scenario 5
AND that the "New and Updated" checkbox is unchecked
AND that the filter is saved
When that filter is selected 
Then the order list and the Status Overview are including orders with any Purchase Order status

(See the attached images)

*Please note that the column and the filter previously called "Order Package" now is called "Purchase Order".*

fields.summary: Show message when no changes are done
fields.description:
As a user 
I want the system to inform me if no changes have been made when I click on Save
so that I will know that I will not trigger any unnecessary exports by mistake

*Scenario 1: No assigned production units*
Given that the user has opened the Production Units tab in edit mode for an order with no assigned production units
AND that after editing still no units are assigned to the order
When the user clicks on the Save button
Then an error message is shown above the manufacturing units; "It is not possible to save since no changes have been made.".
AND the tab remains in edit mode
AND nothing is saved or exported

*Scenario 2: previously assigned production units*
Given that the user has opened the Production Units tab in edit mode for an order with assigned production units
AND that after editing still no changes have been made compared to the previously saved assigned production units of the order
When the user clicks on the Save button
Then an error message is shown above the manufacturing units; "It is not possible to save since no changes have been made.".
AND the tab remains in edit mode
AND nothing is saved or exported
(see the attached image) 

*Scenario 3: The error message is not shown when the user starts editing*
Given Scenario 1 or 2
When the user starts editing 
Then the error message no longer is shown.

*Scenario 4: The error message is not shown when the user clicks on Cancel*
Given Scenario 1 or 2
When the user clicks on the Cancel button 
Then the PU tab is shown in non-edit mode
AND the error message no longer is shown

fields.summary: Production Unit data is not getting populated correctly
fields.description:
Production Unit data is not getting populated correctly in drop down.

Step to repoduce :
1. Open order detail page for an order
2. Click to Assign/Edit button
3. Click to "Select production unit " Drop-down " 
Expected: all production unit having Orderplacementok=1 should display to user
Actual: all component type of production unit  data shown where ordeplacementok=1 or 0 

Analysis data :

Order number : Order: 985902-1676 (0-2014) Babe half sleeve top 
backend query : 
select Externalid,id, OrderPlacementIsOk from productionunit where id in ('66AD62AB-2B6C-43E1-AF73-4CE2D7D6BDA0',
'BF1B3C3F-1C4B-4F6B-B4EE-DBEE9FBAB275',
'98F8CC0B-1016-44E4-9274-D3A4B5ECADB5',
'4CBC4738-9E26-4976-A95C-0C3C364CA4DB',
'66AD62AB-2B6C-43E1-AF73-4CE2D7D6BDA0',
'0C9FC6AA-D633-4578-9993-9F27E6DFEE4B',
'6825C312-21BD-4C36-872D-D782BDCBACB7',
'25D91A22-CA9C-4093-BD10-3F21C661CAB1',
'40D5D2EB-9608-42DF-9EEE-91E2520AF94D') and OrderPlacementIsOk=0

more info will come.

Open Order Spec. Wizard

Assign PU
Add VIP tag to Order
Navigate to SCSC

fields.summary: Received date not set for some deliveries
fields.description:
The information set for Received at DC in OFU doesn't seem to work as it should. Received date not set for some deliveries. 

According to Joakim Borlin the reason for above defect are the following:

When Goods Receipt for an order is received from START it can have two different statuses:
- Received (probably used for partial deliveries)
- Received and completely delivered

In requirement Disco-267 it's only noted that OFU should take are of Goods Receipt with status = Received.
The reason for this is unknown and it is decided that we should set status Received for both statuses:
- Received 
- Received and completely delivered

items.fromString:
The information set for Recieved at DC in OFU doesn't seem to work as it should. Recieved date not set for some deliveries. 

The reason for this is accorind to Jocke:
När vi får leveransinformation från START så kan den komma med två olika statusar, endera har den status = Received eller också har den status = Received and completely delivered.
Den första används troligen i fallet med ”delleveranser” och den andra används när hela kvantiteten levereras på en gång eller när den sista delleveransen har kommit.
 
Vi har ett krav (DISCO-267) som säger att vi bara ska titta på transaktioner av typen status = Received, vilket gör att vi helt enkelt missar leveranser där hela kvantiteten levereras på en gång. Kravet i sig säger inget varför vi bara ska titta på den ena transaktionen och inte heller nånting om bakgrunden till detta beslut.

After some investigation and discussions with Annelie, Magnus L, and Martin below work order should apply to secure we won't just do a qucik fix 1.	The rules for when/and how received is set should be equal regardless of channel and source of information.

2.	When a partial or complete delivery have been delivered to DC the status Received should be set regardless of how much/many pieces that has been delivered.

3.	If there is a possibility to update the date for received when a partial delivery reach DC we should investigate this further. If it’s not possible we should act according to point 1 and 2 above.

Needs to be investigated:
1.	Point 1 above is aligned with current solution
2.	What does current solition look like when it comes to retrieving data from the four different sources
3.	If possible to update the recieved date when partial deliveries are recieved at DC a further discussion with business will be needed.

fields.summary: How to filter on online orders and the field Channel on an order
fields.description:
Today an order can have channel store, online or store/online. 
Channel store/online is set if the order has PM for both online and store. 
The filter critera set in req OFU-881 states:
- Add channel to the frequently used filter 
- By selecting online, orders containing any planning market with channel=online should be displayed 
- By selecting store, orders containing any planning market with channel=store should be displayed.

is this the way it should work? 
Anneli Ohrstrom raised the question that the filter might not give the resulstwished for.

fields.summary: Application throws the exception when Approving the Pre-advice on SprintTest Env
fields.description:
Login to OFU application on Sprint Test Enviroment
Go to Pre-Advice module
On Pending tab, expand a planning market
Select it and click on Approve button

Expected Result: Preadvice should be Approved and removed from screen

fields.summary: One repository
fields.description:
The subtasks needs to be done in the order they are listed below

Use friday afternoon CET 31/10, when other people are on meetings or away

Steps:

1. build is green
2. announce git merge event starts
3. tell everyone to merge their feature branches
4. shut down access to git
5. do the merge
6. verify
7. turn on access to new git
8. announce new git url

Things to communicate:
- no feature branches will be moved
- send out the date when we will do this, so that everyone gets a chance to finish ongoing work
- let OP be involved: update deployment routine docs

fields.summary: Add Validation for Assign PU - No PU or at least one Manufacturing Unit must be assigned
fields.description:
As an OFU merchandiser
I want the system to assist me while assingning PU
So that I will not miss assigning a manufacturing unit to the order

*Preconditions*
OFU-2212 View Production Unit Tab
OFU-2094 View Available Units
OFU-2095 Assign Production Units
OFU-2097 Assign Quantity to Manufacturing Units

*Scenario 1: Error scenario - No manufacturing unit assigned*
Given that the user has opened the Production Unit tab in edit mode
AND that at least one production unit is assigned to the order (i.e. is added to the list)
AND none of the assigned production units is the unit type "Manufacturing Unit"
When the user clicks on the Save button
Then an error message "At least one manufacturing unit must be assigned to the order." is shown in a pink message box above the manufacturing unit/ units.

*Scenario 2: Happy scenario - No production unit in the lists*
Given that the user has opened the Production Unit tab in edit mode
AND that the order had at least one production unit assigned to it when the user entered the edit mode
AND that after editing, all production units are removed (i.e.the list is empty)
When the user clicks on the Save button
Then the changes are saved, i.e. all previously saved production units are removed from the order
AND an export of the PU report containing no production units is initiated 
AND and an export of the assigned PU:s (with no PU:s) is initiated

*Scenario 3: Fixed error scenario - Assigning manufacturing unit*
Given scenario 1
When the user assigns a Manufacturing Unit
Then the error message should be turned off

*Scenario 4: Set PU Status "Assigned"*
GIven OFU-2097 Scenario 10 (i.e. Happy scenario when at least one manufacturing unit is saved)
When the user clicks on the Save button
Then the PU status is set to "Assigned"

*Scenario 5: Set PU Status "Not Assigned"*
GIven Scenario 2
When the user clicks on the Save button
Then the PU status is set to "Not Assigned"

items.toString:
As an OFU merchandiser
I want the system to assist me while assingning PU
So that I will not miss assigning a manufacturing unit to the order

*Preconditions*
OFU-2212 View Production Unit Tab
OFU-2094 View Available Units
OFU-2095 Assign Production Units
OFU-2097 Assign Quantity to Manufacturing Units

*Scenario 1: Error scenario - No manufacturing unit assigned*
Given that the user has opened the Production Unit tab in edit mode
AND that at least one production unit is assigned to the order (i.e. is added to the list)
AND none of the assigned production units is the unit type "Manufacturing Unit"
When the user clicks on the Save button
Then an error message "At least one manufacturing unit must be assigned to the order." is shown in a pink message box above the manufacturing unit/ units.

*Scenario 2: Happy scenario - No production unit assigned*
Given that the user has opened the Production Unit tab in edit mode
AND that no production unit is assigned to the order (i.e.the list is empty)
When the user clicks on the Save button
Then all previously added production units are removed from the order
AND an export of the PU report and an export of the assigned PU:s is initiated
AND the PU status is set to blank /  "Not Assigned"

*Scenario 3: Fixed error scenario - Assigning manufacturing unit*
Given scenario 1
When the user assigns a Manufacturing Unit
Then the error message should be turned off

As an OFU merchandiser

Then an error message "At least one manufacturing unit must be assigned to the order." is shown in a pink message box above the manufacturing unit/ units.

Given that the user has opened the Production Unit tab in edit mode
AND that the order had at least one production unit assigned to it when the user entered the edit mode

Then the changes are saved, i.e. all previously saved production units are removed from the order
AND an export of the PU report containing no production units and an export of the assigned PU:s (with no PU:s) is initiated

fields.summary: Status overview should not be visible on Other Orders tab
fields.description:
*Scenario*
The user has navigated to Other orders and clicks on the Status overview tab

*Actual result*
When clicking on the "status overview" tab, the user is navigated to My orders again.

*Expected result*
The tab "Status overview" should be opened, still on the Other orders view

fields.summary: View Order Details Buttons Renamed and Rearranged
fields.description:
As an OFU user 
I want the the Order Details buttons to be renamed and rearranged 
So that the names will reflect the proper meaning and the position of the buttons will reflect its order in the work process

*Scenario 1: View renamed "Send Order Package" button*
Given that the Order Details page is open
When viewing the navigation buttons above the tabs
Then the button previously called "Send Order Spec Pack" is changed to "Send Order Package"

*Scenario 2: Show the "Secure Composition" and the "Send Order Package" buttons in new positions*
Given Scenario 1
When viewing the navigation buttons above the tabs
Then the "Secure Composition" button is shown first (i.e. to the left)
AND the "Send Order Package" button is shown last (i.e. to the right)

-Scenario 3: New icon for the "Send Order Package" button-
-Given Scenario 1-
-When viewing the navigation buttons above the tabs-
-Then the "Send Order Package" button is shown with a new icon - see image "New icon below-

*Scenario 4: PU tab shown as the last tab (not the first)*
Given Scenario 1
When viewing the tabs of the order details page
Then the "Production Units" tab is shown last (to the right) 
AND the order of the tabs is (from left to right); “Delivery Info”, “Article & Size”, “Price & Package”, “Production Units”. 


See the attached image files

update OrderPreProductionStatus set ProductionUnitStatus = 'QTY Diff' where orderid= 'F29989E6-FE4E-438F-B1CE-A1F500DCC7C3'
2) Login to OFU application and move to Status overview tab and check the staus in PU column
Actual Result: "QTY Diff" value not displayed in PU column with background color Orange. It was Blank

Expected Result: "QTY Diff" value must be displayed in PU column with background color Orange.

fields.summary: L/S status values not seen on UI
fields.description:
Tested with faked data created in database table "OrderPreProductionStatus"

1) Created the fake data for status L/S using the query:
update OrderPreProductionStatus set LicenseSampleStatus = 'Received' where orderid= 'F29989E6-FE4E-438F-B1CE-A1F500DCC7C3'
2) Opened the OFU application and checked the Status overview tab for this order number
Autual Result: Status "received" did not displayed in L/S status column for the order number. It was Blank. 

Expected Result: Status "Received" should be displayed in L/S status column for the order number
Also tested for other status, values are not getting reflected on UI.
